description: Explore key inventions and discoveries that shaped science

slides.title: Welcome to Scientific Milestones
slides.content:
# Introduction to Scientific Milestones

Welcome to **Scientific Milestones** - breakthroughs that changed everything!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Microscope** - Seeing the tiny world
- **Periodic Table** - Organizing elements
- **Penicillin** - Fighting infection
- **Internet** - Connecting the world

> **Fun Fact:** Fleming almost threw away the mold that would become penicillin!

slides.title: The Microscope
slides.content:
# Invention of the Microscope

## Timeline:
- 1590s: Dutch lens makers (Janssen)
- 1665: Hooke's Micrographia (cells)
- 1670s: Leeuwenhoek (bacteria)

## Robert Hooke:
- Coined term 'cell'
- Drew detailed observations
- Compound microscope

## Leeuwenhoek:
- Simple but powerful lenses
- Discovered microorganisms
- 'Animalcules'

## Impact:
- Revealed invisible world
- Foundation of microbiology
- Cell theory development

slides.title: The Periodic Table
slides.content:
# Development of Periodic Table

## Dmitri Mendeleev (1869):
- Arranged by atomic weight
- Predicted unknown elements
- Left gaps in table

## Key Predictions:
| Predicted | Actual (Found) |
|-----------|----------------|
| Eka-aluminum | Gallium (1875) |
| Eka-silicon | Germanium (1886) |
| Eka-boron | Scandium (1879) |

## Modern Table:
- Arranged by atomic number
- 118 elements
- Mendeleev's structure preserved

## Impact:
- Organized chemistry
- Predicted new elements
- Understanding of atomic structure

slides.title: Penicillin Discovery
slides.content:
# Discovery of Penicillin

## Alexander Fleming (1928):
- Noticed mold killing bacteria
- Staphylococcus cultures
- Penicillium mold contamination

## Development:
- Fleming identified but couldn't purify
- Florey and Chain (1940s)
- Mass production for WWII

## Impact:
- First true antibiotic
- Saved millions of lives
- Nobel Prize 1945
- Era of antibiotics began

## Challenges Today:
- Antibiotic resistance
- Need for new drugs
- Superbugs (MRSA)

slides.title: DNA Structure
slides.content:
# Discovery of DNA Structure

## 1953: Watson and Crick
- Double helix structure
- Cambridge University

## Key Contributors:
| Scientist | Contribution |
|-----------|-------------|
| Rosalind Franklin | X-ray crystallography |
| Maurice Wilkins | X-ray images |
| Watson & Crick | Model building |
| Chargaff | Base pairing rules |

## The Structure:
- Double helix
- A pairs with T
- G pairs with C
- Base sequence = genetic code

## Impact:
- Modern genetics founded
- Biotechnology enabled
- Human genome project

slides.title: Internet Creation
slides.content:
# Creation of the Internet

## Timeline:
| Year | Event |
|------|-------|
| 1969 | ARPANET (4 nodes) |
| 1971 | First email |
| 1983 | TCP/IP adopted |
| 1989 | WWW proposed (Berners-Lee) |
| 1991 | WWW goes public |

## Key Figures:
- Vint Cerf & Bob Kahn (TCP/IP)
- Tim Berners-Lee (WWW)
- DARPA funding

## Impact:
- Global communication
- Information access
- E-commerce
- Social transformation

## Today:
- 5+ billion users
- Foundation of digital economy

slides.quizQuestion: The World Wide Web was invented by:

slides.title: Vaccine Development
slides.content:
# Vaccine Development

## First Vaccine:
- Edward Jenner (1796)
- Smallpox vaccine
- Cowpox as protection

## Pasteur's Contributions:
- Rabies vaccine (1885)
- Germ theory application
- Attenuated viruses

## Modern Vaccines:
| Disease | Vaccine |
|---------|--------|
| Polio | Salk (1955), Sabin oral |
| Measles | 1963 |
| COVID-19 | mRNA (2020) |

## Impact:
- Smallpox eradicated (1980)
- Billions of lives saved
- Herd immunity concept

slides.title: Nuclear Energy
slides.content:
# Nuclear Energy Discovery

## Key Events:
| Year | Milestone |
|------|----------|
| 1896 | Radioactivity (Becquerel) |
| 1938 | Nuclear fission discovered |
| 1942 | First reactor (Chicago Pile-1) |
| 1945 | Atomic bombs |
| 1954 | First nuclear power plant |

## Scientists:
- Marie & Pierre Curie (radioactivity)
- Enrico Fermi (reactor)
- Otto Hahn (fission)

## Dual Nature:
- Power generation
- Medical applications
- Weapons potential
- Waste challenges

slides.title: Space Exploration
slides.content:
# Space Exploration Milestones

## Key Events:
| Year | Achievement |
|------|------------|
| 1957 | Sputnik 1 |
| 1961 | First human (Gagarin) |
| 1969 | Moon landing |
| 1990 | Hubble Telescope |
| 2021 | James Webb Telescope |

## Impact:
- Satellites (GPS, weather, comm)
- Scientific discoveries
- International cooperation
- Technology spinoffs

## Future:
- Mars exploration
- Commercial space
- Artemis program

slides.title: Modern Computing
slides.content:
# Computing Milestones

## Early Computers:
- ENIAC (1945): First electronic
- Turing's theoretical work
- Von Neumann architecture

## Personal Computing:
| Year | Milestone |
|------|----------|
| 1971 | Microprocessor (Intel 4004) |
| 1976 | Apple I |
| 1981 | IBM PC |
| 1984 | Macintosh GUI |

## Modern Era:
- Smartphones (2007+)
- Cloud computing
- AI and machine learning

## Impact:
- Transformed every industry
- Information revolution

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Scientific Milestones Summary

## Key Discoveries:
| Milestone | Year | Impact |
|-----------|------|--------|
| Microscope | 1590s | Revealed microworld |
| Periodic Table | 1869 | Organized chemistry |
| Penicillin | 1928 | Saved millions |
| DNA Structure | 1953 | Modern genetics |
| Internet | 1969-91 | Connected world |

## Common Themes:
- Often accidental discoveries
- Build on earlier work
- Transform society
- Enable further breakthroughs

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Scientific Milestones!
